alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 4:58PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Including the following area, Yentna, Skwenta and Susitna Rivers. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. People should take immediate precautions for safety and to move threatened property to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 449 PM AKDT, Local observers along the Yenta River report that the river is over bank in many locations with overbank flooding along the Skwenta and Yentna river. As of Monday afternoon over bank water depths along the Yentna River were estimated between 1 and 3 feet with cabins and outbuildings at numerous lodges being reported as flooding. River levels were reported as possibly the highest in the last ten years. - Moderate rain is expected to continue in the headwaters of the Skwenta and Yentna Rivers through Tuesday afternoon with an additional 1 to 3 inches possible. Water levels on the Yentna and Skwenta river are expected to continue rising through Wednesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Please stay tuned to weather.gov/Anchorage, NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
